result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J. Nimocks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Serve 1 year conditional jail time in the Richland County Jail, with work release, and 0 days credit, stayed until on or before December 4, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.

Pay for, successfully complete, and attend any programs or educational sessions required by the agent.

Pay fine and costs totaling $1835.00.  All of this will be paid out of the Defendant's bond.  When Defendant signs up for probation, the only money that he will owe will be that collected by DOC for supervision fees.
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

records.addlTxt: Count 1

15CF40: 
Count 1- 4.5 years total sentence in the WI prison system with 18 months as initial confinement and 3 years as extended supervision. Dodge Correctional as correction center. Eligible or all programming. Conditions of ES- Attend pay for, and successfully, any programming recommended by agent, obey rules and regulations of DOC, Apply for, and if accepted, successfully complete Richland Cty TC. 344 days credit. 

18CF113:
Count 1- 3 years probation, 6mo conditional jail time, consecutive to prison sentence in 15CF40 with Huber. Conditions of probation: Attend pay for, and successfully, any programming recommended by agent, obey rules and regulations of DOC, Apply for, and if accepted, successfully complete Richland Cty TC, $600 plus costs, 2yr revocation, 2 yr IID, AODA assessment, must submit DNA sample. 
Count 2&3-Dismissed and read in.

18CM39: 
Count 1- 6 months in county jail, concurrent to prison sentence.
Count 2- 6 months in county jail, concurrent to prison sentence.
Count 3- 6 months in county jail, concurrent to prison sentence.
Count 4- 6 months in county jail, concurrent to prison sentence.

records.addlTxt:
4 cases called together:  15CF40 and 15TR601-603.  Defendant Ryan J. Nimocks in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. A states the parties have reached an agreement for resolution whereby def will be pleading to the OWI 5th charge in 15CF40 for an agreed-upon probation disposition.

Def pleads guilty to OWI 5th.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  

Sentence:  Withheld for 3 years probation.  Conditions:  1 year county jail with work release.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Must pay for, succ. complete, and attend any programs or educational sessions that agent requires.  $600 plus costs.  3 years revocation.  3 years IID upon relicensing.  $66 blood draw cost - State.  Credit:  0 days.  Submit DNA sample before signing up for probation today.  Atty. A asks for stay of jail until Dec. 4th.  No objection by the DA.  Court stays the conditional jail time until 6-7 a.m. on Dec. 4th.  

Court provides felony admonishments including firearm prohibition notice.

TR cases dismissed.
Status conference at 11-04-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Ryan J. Nimocks in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def stands mute to charge for NG plea. Clerk is directed to enter NG plea. Further statu/possible plea is requested and set  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Staying Administrative Suspension (emailed this date by the clerk to the DMV's administrative suspension unit)
Arraignment at 09-16-2015 09:00 am
and Inspection
Arraignment at 09-02-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Ryan J. Nimocks in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Matter on the calendar for status.  Counsel advise the Court that def wishes to waive his right to prelim.  Court's colloquy with def re prelim waiver.  Waiver accepted.  Bindover ordered.  Arraignment requested and set.  Arraignment scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference at 07-01-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Ryan J. Nimocks in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Angel states def is willing to waive time limits for prelim, requests status scheduling. Court's colloquy re. waiver of time limits for prelim. Comment by def. Court accepts waiver of time limits on prelim.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
of TN - $2500 bond to be applied to attorney fees (at request of TN, returned $2500 was cut directly to Atty. Angel and sent by the clerk to Atty. Angel)
Same conditions as previous bond.
Adjourned initial appearance at 05-22-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Ryan J. Nimocks in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def states he plans to hire Atty. T Angel; asks for part of the bond money ($2500) to be released for purposes of retainer.  Court notes that the money was not posted by the Def; states that, if posters of bond  file a sworn affidavit that they will use returned bond to pay for retainer (bond assignment), Court will consider request to return $2500 of the bond and place the def, instead, on a $7500 cash bond.  Court adjourns this matter to May 22 at 2; instructs def to inform Atty. Angel of that date/time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

(Court has directed clerk to produce an amended $7500 cash bond and return the $2500 bond assignment money as soon as the sworn affidavit of the poster is filed with the clerk.)
to Those Posting Cash Bond - TJN
No alcohol.  Test on demand.  No bars/taverns.  Submit to printing/booking.
